content:
y 27
Early Access Review
								If Steep hadn't crash landed so horribly, I might have never touched this game again.If you're here because you want another ssx, don't bother. I wouldn't say this game is incredibly realistic but it's fun nevertheless.I play in first person as a skiier, and the thrill of proximity tree skiing or landing perfect park jumps is most accurately displayed here. However, I have no hours as a snowboarder, and that experience may be completely different.The Soundtrack is pretty small, but the songs are fitting for the style of the game. Adrian Blood, "SNOW" on soundcloud.The big flaw I have with the game is the landscape. Obviously it's just snow, but cliff faces and forests all look identical. The steps the devs need to take ot fix this are eitherA: Rework Sialia with better terrain and tree variety/densityB: Replace Sialia with multiple mountains, each featuring a different style of ski/snowboard. Ex.    -heavily forested, gladed map   -double black alpine chutes and cliffs   -Backcountry freeskiingAnd the park variety they have now is working pretty well, but rails are still pretty underwhelming.SNOW is a great game for (what I assume is) a niche audience. Not to mention that it is also free, so no harm in trying it out. It's an aquired taste.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
y 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Here is a game that needed to be made, as there is a massive gap in the market for games like SNOW. A beautiful snow covered mountain is the setting as you and your skiis glide down steep slopes and dodge through wintery forests. SNOW is a beautiful game. However, it is in alpha/beta stage and its all very basic at the moment, you get the distinct feeling that they are struggling to update this game in time for release, it has its fair share of bugs and glitches but on top of all that is a distinctly beautiful experience with a great sound track and a game that is unrivaled in what it sets out to do. It is a Skiing game that captures the beauty and speed of skiing, and it is the best on any console right now. Hopefully the developers will cross the finish line with a game that we can all be proud to have played, but until then, its a waiting game. 8.5/10Pro's - * Has the potential to be the best skiing game ever* Amazing mountain sandbox* Graphics* Has multiplayerCons- *They havent made it yet.* gltichy and buggy (including the physics)* Future is uncertain* Multiplayer is laggy at the moment (devs have stated this should improve with server improvement)

content:
y 27
Early Access Review
								If Steep hadn't crash landed so horribly, I might have never touched this game again.If you're here because you want another ssx, don't bother. I wouldn't say this game is incredibly realistic but it's fun nevertheless.I play in first person as a skiier, and the thrill of proximity tree skiing or landing perfect park jumps is most accurately displayed here. However, I have no hours as a snowboarder, and that experience may be completely different.The Soundtrack is pretty small, but the songs are fitting for the style of the game. Adrian Blood, "SNOW" on soundcloud.The big flaw I have with the game is the landscape. Obviously it's just snow, but cliff faces and forests all look identical. The steps the devs need to take ot fix this are eitherA: Rework Sialia with better terrain and tree variety/densityB: Replace Sialia with multiple mountains, each featuring a different style of ski/snowboard. Ex.    -heavily forested, gladed map   -double black alpine chutes and cliffs   -Backcountry freeskiingAnd the park variety they have now is working pretty well, but rails are still pretty underwhelming.SNOW is a great game for (what I assume is) a niche audience. Not to mention that it is also free, so no harm in trying it out. It's an aquired taste.

content:
y 27
Early Access Review
								This is so good for a f2p game. I love it, but it has some things to improve on. But its worth it.It has alot of potential. (Dont get greedy and make something 100 euro just to play the game pls)Only flaw is that they should update some stuff.The snow needs updating (no pun), because sometimes my snowboard is under the snow, so it disappears.They should make it more smooth (like in the video -_-).But cmon.. Nothing can beat a F2P, open world, skiing/snowboarding game. They should also make more tricks (advanced ones), so that you can use some of the letters on the keyboard. But it says i need a controller, so i dont really know how it feels like if you have a controller.I also love how you get money just by leveling up, so that you dont need to spend 9.99 euro to buy clothes and drones and snowmobiles etc.You can pimp your character, ooo! They should make it so you can customize your characters real face. (not mask and glasses and hat etc).I also hate how it freezes sometimes (not sure if its my pc), that bothers me alot.So ill give it a 7/10, it has some things to improve on, but its playable and a great idea.But ill uninstall it, and come back later when it has some more updates.

content:
er 29, 2013
Early Access Review
								If you are an avid skier or snowboarder you will absolutely love this game, and its only in ALPHA. People that are talking crap about this game have no idea how much potential this game already has and beats any snwboarding/skiing game out there for any console. I don't even Ski and I love it already, once snowboarding is released I will be in heaven.I got the tester pack for $15 and it really isn't that much money to put out a game for a game that's in alpha. Also you have to keep in mind there is a small team of developers (who are also probably skiers and snowboarders) that need money to help further develop this game. The ability to freeze the game and make your own screenshot's from your jumps/tricks is awesome. I cannot wait until the full potential of this game is released.I just have to point out all of the people that are so angry they paid $10 or $20 on a game thats in ALPHA that has a team of less than 10 developers. This isn't some big game company making another Call of Duty. They can't afford a team of 10-20+ QUALIFIED testers to come in and debug there game in a month+ and have it ready to go. An alpha will last for quite some time. Then there will be a BETA where there will STILL be bugs. What are you are paying for are is early access and bug testing. Everything that says that is currently available in the game (talking to those of you complaining about no sound when it was clearly stated there is NO SOUND yet) is clearly stated on here, if you can't read that and understand what ALPHA means, you're an absolute moron.

content:
ry 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								Hello to any person interested in the game SNOW! Although it was released in October 2010 the dev team have decided to stay in this early access open beta so they can maximize crowd feedback and also implement fun new ideas. When you get this game I would recommend you have an appreciation for the sports and kind of game at hand. What you get is a Free to Play open world Skiing game with abilities to customize your character and eventually you'll be able to build snow jumps on the side of a mountain! The Physics and Graphics are great and make for a great time spent with some random people or you can go on a solo exploration in free roam.Things to keep in mind:Customizations are bought through Gold which you can either buy or earn while playing...you gain 25-35 every so often upon leveling up. I spent about $10 and could pretty much put a outfit together.The team is currently working on the Snowboard/Snowmobile options.With the realistic feel and the great graphics I wouldnt see any reason not to get this game at  the steep price of ZERO!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
y 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Recently got this game for $1 through ♥♥♥ and honestly I didn't have very high expectations, but after only 2+ hours I have been suprised at the level of detail in the environment and the amount of effort the developers have put in to SNOW. Saying that, I still do have concerns with this game.Pros:- Very large open world to explore with multiple mountains and drop points.- Clean UI and a fantastic soundtrack.- Hidden secrets and locations to come across (caves, castles, etc).- The graphics are great, not mindblowing, but it certainly looks "next gen".- Atmospheric. I can imagine this being very immersive with VR...- Simple controls and fun gameplay.Cons:- The biggest concern for me is that from what I know, there is no way to get credits without buying them with real money. Especially since the developers boast a high level of customisation and character creation. Paying $15 for a new set of pants and a jacket simply isn't worth it, and if they look at games such as Payday 2 and Killing Floor 2, they will see that expensive microtransactions can drive a supportive fanbase away.- At the time of writing this, there are a lot of bugs. I have had the game crash on my multiple times during my time playing. - Multiplayer isn't great. It's not bad, but needs improvement.- Grinding doesn't work very well. A few reccomendations - Add an additional way to get credits.- Needs more animations. Not my biggest issue, but a lot of other people feel the need for it too. Take a leaf out of SSX's book.- Being able to interact with the world around you would be great. Taking a ride on the lifts, meeting your friends in a cabin etc.TL;DR - Is this game fun? Definately. Is it worth paying $10 for? No.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is to Jonny Moseley Mad Trix as Skate 3 is to the Tony Hawk Pro Skater series.If the goal of sport-simulation games are to recreate the emotions and emulate the motions from their target, SNOW is taking the right steps toward that goal.From the start, I'm most immediately impressed with the visuals and aurals. The UI, models, and mountain itself with all its parts are gorgeous even on the lowest settings, which still beat up my GPU/CPU - no complaints as I'm using some older gear. There's a radio-style soundtrack that plays some great stuff that I want to get in my library - sorta electronica styled, I heard some vocal tracks, too. Reminds me of Chairlift or Bloc Party. The swoosh of skis and - though I haven't grinded rails or pulled off crazy jumps - the grinds sound real and constant enough to immersify me.As a cross-country and downhill skiier of 8 years, the game targets my demographic of speed-seekers - but I can see the appeal to anyone who likes an open world where you can choose your fun. Meditatively ski from point A to B, gazing across the valley - or shred hard and fast off-piste taking opportune upward slopes to show off your aerial skills. I'm eager to virtually ski again, eager to get better gear to play full-screen on high graphics, eager to see every patch of SNOW there is to be seen.

Early Access Review

Early Access Review
								The Physics model seem broken, it takes way too long to build up speed, even on steep slopes it feels way to slow, no sense of speed. And the Control Scheme needs tweeking, the right stick is used to control the camera, but in the air its used for tricks, but if you hit the stick too soon, your camera gets all "♥♥♥♥y" and you end up not doing any tricks. Maybe crouching for a jump and crouching for speed should be the same control, and maybe you should crouch with the right stick. Honestly this game feels like it needs to be rebuilt from the ground up.

content:
y 3
Early Access Review
								"+ Great storytelling.+ Its themes evolve as the story progresses in Afterstory.+ Incredibly emotional.+ Unique characters that all provide purpose to the story in some way or another.+ Nagisa, Kotomi, Tomoyo, Ibuki, Kyou, and Sunohara are top tier best girls.+ Akio and Sanae are the best parents I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing.+ Exceptional humor.+ Extremely replayable.+ One of the most genuine MC's in Visual Novels (Tomoya Okazaki)+ Unique story where you actually SEE the married life of a couple and the relationship they had prior.+ Easily the best OST I have ever heard in a game, each one contributing so much to the message each scene is trying to portray. Snowfield is honestly one of my favorite song in videogames, making me cry because of the beauty of the scene it was involved in.+ Afterstory is my favorite 2nd half in a visual novel alongside Steins;Gate, evolving its themes to a much more family orientated setting as well as providing emotional heartbreak that no other game could ever provide except this one.+ The ending is amazing and the use of the "orb lights" is one of my favorite plot elements ever, being detailed enough for hardcore analysis on the role it played in the final moments of Clannad.+ The Illusionary World is absolutely genius.+ Another aspect I enjoy about the themes of Clannad is that they are family orientated and could honestly help anyone in need of advice on what to do with their life, offering many unique perspectives on certain ideals that are evident in the world we live in.- Art is charming however it is definitely not for everyone.- The game is on average 80+ hours, being one of the longest videogame scripts EVER!!!Overall Clannad was a 10/10 for me. I don't think I have experienced a story as great as this one since the original Steins;Gate and Steins;Gate 0. The way Clannad tells its story in such a simple but unique way, constantly evolving with time progressions is truly a thought provoking and "valuable" experience. I'd recommend this to anyone that wants to involve themselves in the "Visual Novel" medium as it is the best one I have ever played besides Steins;Gate. The game is worth every cent, 50 dollars is honestly not a bad price for one of the best games of the genre, BUY THIS and enjoy it, as it a truly profound and life altering experience!"

content:
y 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am not that good at writing reviews but here goes:SNOW, is an absolute delight. I was more than happy tp buy the founders pack knowing that the money would hopefully be going to the developers of such and amazing game.  The beauty of it all is breath taking. If you haven't been ontop of a Mountain as the Sun rises or sets this is pretty damn close.Yes this may be early alpha but it still handles amazingly. No major bugs that causes you to rip your hair out, just funny little ones such and not wiping out after htting and rock and just standing there like "I don't give a F***".  The controls are easy once you learn them and you can happily explore all over the mountain, and it isn't even finished yet!I urge you to buy this game, it is fantastic.

1, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is so incredibly unfinished that "Early Access" is an overstatement. This is barely even idea, let alone anywhere near alpha.No sound. Crashes. No control scheme or explanation. Textures refuse to stream. map is poorly designed in terms of player speed versus amount of obstacles. Playing with friends is impossible as it crashes. Tantalising menu options that are greyed out and presumably will never be finished. 6+ months in early access and it's still a complete sham. Would not recommend spending money on this until it's actually released. What the community is doing now is not helping development or finding bugs - the entire game is a bug and grossly unplayable.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
y 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Here is a game that needed to be made, as there is a massive gap in the market for games like SNOW. A beautiful snow covered mountain is the setting as you and your skiis glide down steep slopes and dodge through wintery forests. SNOW is a beautiful game. However, it is in alpha/beta stage and its all very basic at the moment, you get the distinct feeling that they are struggling to update this game in time for release, it has its fair share of bugs and glitches but on top of all that is a distinctly beautiful experience with a great sound track and a game that is unrivaled in what it sets out to do. It is a Skiing game that captures the beauty and speed of skiing, and it is the best on any console right now. Hopefully the developers will cross the finish line with a game that we can all be proud to have played, but until then, its a waiting game. 8.5/10Pro's - * Has the potential to be the best skiing game ever* Amazing mountain sandbox* Graphics* Has multiplayerCons- *They havent made it yet.* gltichy and buggy (including the physics)* Future is uncertain* Multiplayer is laggy at the moment (devs have stated this should improve with server improvement)

content:
y 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is one I recommend to almost anyone.Whether you like Skiing or not, you can still find fun in this game. Going fast down a mountain and doing flips and grabs attempting to dodge trees and rocks is adrenaline pumping and will surely make you happy. The graphics are amazing despite being an Early Access Game and there are almost no noticeable bugs. Realism is something that could be added as I enjoy skiing in real life as much as in games. Jumps seem too easy and spinning sometimes gets too fast. If you do not have enough to fund this game yet, you can check out one other game that looks similar to this called Shredsauce.http://www.shredsauce.com/

Early Access Review
								The game is extremly sluggish, the always online part of it is terrible. I bought this planning on playing it while deployed to sea for a few weeks. Well you cant play the game without being conected to the server. So that is one huge down fall. The next is the horrificly glitch snow surface. Your person feels like their legs are solid logs and the snow feels like concrete that if you try to turn it snags you up. The game has great potential but they got the physics model all wrong. If you want a game like this go buy infinate air, way better game and physics, or buy steep when that comes out.

content:
, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								Great game, big selling potential. Unique in it's genre. Graphics are beautiful. Played skiing only with xbox one controller. A few points to make this game even better:1. award points for great speed instead of stunts only.2. fix skiing tutorial: it's bugged in the part where you have to do a 720. Can't continue even if you complete the 720. 3. make sure you can also break while cornering which you can also do in real life and make sure you can use the break to stand still instantly, also possible in real life. 4. add ability to make own playlist of music.5. don't add ingame money which you need to buy with real money. Make us earn in game money by completing events. 6. make a (time trial) event for every slope. 7. make skiing over roads slow you down instead of just going the same speed as if it were snow. I hope this feedback helps!

r 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is actually the best sports videogame I have ever played.  I thought it wouldn't be as good as it was because there are a lot of bad comments on the game but actually this is a very fun game.  The only downside to this game there is a few very small bugs in it but big deal. You can go to the shop, freestyle down massive hills, go to events, level up and there are many more things to do which totally make up for a couple small bugs.  But what really makes this game come to life is the awesome graphics.  If you have ever played Skyrim Elder scrolls 5 this game as has better graphics then Skyrim.You can do awesome flips and tricks which give you points depending on what trick you do  And even better there is a fair bit of tricks to do.Well that is all I really want to talk about.  Discover the rest of the features for yourself and have a blast riding down epic mountians!

Early Access Review

content:
er 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								I found the controller controls to be harder to use than the keyboard, so I actually recommend the keyboard.  I just heavily recommend rebinding the "flip forward" key to anything other than the same key for "move forward" (W).  I use the 2 key.It's also frustrating having to start at the beginning of the run every time you crash, which for some maps (Bluesky Burgers) is incredibly annoying because you have to spend 15 seconds every time rounding the lodge before you even get to the course.  If there was an option to respawn just a little higher up the mountain from where you fell/crashed, that would make this game infinitely better.  OR just make it so a crash doesn't end your run -- make the player fall down, but let him get back up and keep going?  Just penalize the player with XP or something.As of now I really like the game, it's just these fixes seem so obvious that it's annoying to play knowing how easily it could be fixed.But regardless of those points, I do recommend it.

Early Access Review

content:
4, 2015
Early Access Review
								One word somes up an Early Access title like this one, WOW. (haha wow, like the doge hahahahaahha stfu). I'm going to be 100% honest and say I really don't know where to begin. Seriously, I don't know why this game is as much as fun as it is. The physics still need work, they're are quite a bit of glitches and animations still need some work. But despite everything I can find sloppy or slack within in this game it's still just so amazingly fun. The graphics are immersive to say the least and the sound design is just, ah, pristine. There really isn't much to be said. There is endless fun and potential within this game and its worth every penny. In my case, 50 pennys, and by pennys I mean dollars because I have no problem with dropping that amount of money on such an amazing game and its amazing customization, the team at Poppermost deserve it. Thank you Poppermost for making a great game to complment my saturday night pizza.Score: 9/10Pros:=>Amazing Sound=>In depth customization=>Well priced micro transactions (IMO)=>Endless fun=>Easy controls for controllers=>Dat afterbang thoughCons:=>Bugs and glitches=>Unresponsive menu=>Mother ♥♥♥♥ing rocks.

content:
ry 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Purchased this as it boasted VR Support and showed the Oculas Rift on its webpage. Unfortunatly this is a purchase I very much regret for now.WHile it looks and plays fine in 2D for an Alpha product, when you enable 3D via the Oculas Rift I found the game unplayable. This is the only time i've found the experience better in 2D than in 3D through the rift.General complaints are: Low Framerate (Even when all settings are set to low)Very Flat "3D" objects. Such as Trees and background. (Looks like a flat picture as the background)Distancing issue with objects (The moon appears about 4 meters away from your head and closer than other objects)Very sparse amount of 3D objects so you get a very poor 3D feel.View disorientating. (If your character is infront of your view. Head tracking does not work correctly) When in "First Person" any character movement affects your view.Overall I would not recommend this game for use with the Oculas Rift as its a disappointing experience. If this changes, im happy to update this review.

content:
9, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've owned this game since it was first released as closed beta or something on Steam when you still had to pay for the game. I've watched the game evolve from just a game you could ride around to what it is now. I don't know what I think about the games state right now, but it's still a lot of fun for a couple of hours. You have a few different maps, whereas there is one you'll probably find yourself playing on the most. The big mountain Sialia is the biggest free area in the whole game, and here you can find everything. Slopes, parks with both big and small jumps, rails, half pipes etc, and you can find some super cool off-piste lines by exploring yourself. Once you find a new spawnpoint, you can always come back there. Trickwise there are many. There are many cool grabs, although I would like to see even more combinations. You can rotate in every way possible. Backwards, forwards, do rolls, 360s and combine all of them for a sideflip or something else. This is good.Contentwise there are many maps to play, but as a free to play game you have to pay for most of them. I have not purchased anything other than the starterpack back when I first purchased the game, but I still find it fun when I have 30 minutes to do something, so purchasing anything isn't neccesary at all.

content:
3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Keeping in mind this game is early access AND free to play, this game is amazing. The graphics are absolutely stunning. There could be more music tracks but the ones that are in game are great. Remappable controls were recently added and that makes things even easier to do. There are a few glitches here and there but the devs are very helpful and willing to communicate on the discussion forums. Though this game is free to play I'd be willing to pay upwards of $20 even for the state it is currently in. Snowboards and snowmobiles are coming soon along with many other updates and bug fixes which is even more incentive to keep playing. Keep up the great work guys, I can't wait to see what's to come.

Early Access Review

I'm almost certain just finishing the course without any collision awards a Bronze - but silver and gold need additional information.2. I am unable to turn off the music in the game. Says due to some sort of graphical error. Resulting in me having to reboot my machine to start the game again.  4. Glad to see Steam Achievements added - However they are all hidden so you don't even know what to do to unlock them. Annnnnoying.5. Leaderboards are broken---please make them actually work correctly. 6. ZERO CUSTOMIZATION of your rider. All the gear is PURCHASEABLE only. NEED BOTH FREE AND PAID CONTENT... DONT BE STUPID.

content:
er 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								I just received my beta key today from SNOW after waiting a while. This game is incredible, but noticably unfinished, but that's ok. This game, being in beta, obviously has a lot of quirks that need to be ironed out, yet in the state its in, is still an interesting and fun game. I'll try to update this review as I play some more, and as updates come in, but as a first impression, here's what I have:- The vastness of the mountain is incredible: So far I've been able to access one mountain with 4 "sides", with their own parks and trails. The size and structure of the mountain is very large, and if and when more are implemented, will give this game more than enough variety.- The character customization is really cool: You have a large selection of real life gear, from head to toe. Each piece costs credits, which you can buy with real money, but is really cool nonetheless. Having microtransactions for cosmetic items is a great way to generate revenue in a free to play game.- The tricks are cool, but there are quirks: I'm still learning how to maneuver well, but the tricks are generally well done. Airs are decently well timed, although you do pretty much land anything as long as you're not upside down. The rail slides are pretty broken to be honest, there's no real feedback that you've done a railslide, and hopping on to rails isn't exactly satisfying.Overall, the game is alot of fun in its current state and I'm super excited to see how it's going to look once all the quirks are ironed out.

content:
y 20
Early Access Review
								I have over 100 games in my steam library and this is my FIRST review (I think...) so let that sink in for a moment before you judge my comments.This game has to be the most RAGE INDUCING piece of crud I have ever played, and I grew up playing Battletoads. I'm just going to keep it simple;PROS:- Great visuals and atmosphere.- Easy to use controls and can be used with a controller (recommended).- Awesome soundtrack (in my opinion, the most refined thing about the game).- It's free.CONS:- Touch a rock, you die.- You land slightly off, you die.- Touch ice, you die. (I'm serious, the amount of times I've landed softly on ice and died).- When you spawn at the start of an event, your character sometimes decided to go the wrong way.- The game feels empty, there just aren't enough players to make multiplayer feel worth it.- No Multiplayer events (not that I've found, maybe you have to pay)- When you die your board magically flies away and you have to respawn at the start (even in free mode) *like seriously, I'd much prefer it if my character got up, brushed themselves off and carried on.You might feel that my cons are over exaggerated, however I've been playing for just over 5 hours and already its making me develop cancer. It's a shame, it has potential, it's just not being used.

number of helpful: 7 of 15 people (47%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
y 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								SNOWBOARDING IS HERE. still needs some work, but its a ton of funAPRIL UPDATE-Snowboarding and snowmobiles on the way at the end of this month!(i know this isnt a real update to a review, that will come when they are actually implemented)P.S. Lulz @ skiholes who didnt like my review because of snowboard comments~OPEN BETA UPDATE~After a rough start the devs pumped out multiple hotfixes within a day and have the game up and running. definately worth checking out.also remember to harass the devs to add snowboarding like they said they were going to.~WRITTEN DURING CLOSED BETA~In a world where realistic extreme sports games are no more, especially on PC, SNOW is a light in the darkness. Thats not to say its without its problems though. Pros-Physics. I've worked as a liftie in Vt and can say the feel of being on snow/rails/boxes is all solid and in line with really cruising down a mountain-Optional First Person Mode. Why havent more extreme sports games done first person? there arent words to describe hitting a double cork 1080 in first person.-Open Mountain. you literally have accesss to the ENTIRE mountain. want trails? they are there. want a park? there are a few. want backcountry, go nuts.-Ragdoll Bails. While these arent the most realistic animations in the world, they will leave you cringing and laughing after you smash a rock at speedCons-No Snowboarding. This is a big one for me. when this game was on kickstarter the devs were promising snowboarding was going to be added as soon as the basics of skiing were in. this has not happened and there has been no news to hint that it is still planned. it leaves the mountains feeling like those douchey ski only resorts. wheres the boarder love?-rough multiplayer. the devs announced that they will be upgrading thier servers when the game goes to open beta. this is very much needed as a random lag spike can kill an amazing run down the mountain or ruin a nice freeroam follow the leader session-microtransactions. there are a lot of them. essentially everything to customize your rider costs real money (not much compared to some other games though) there also appears to be some "events" that you buy into with real money (havent tried these so i cant speak to much on them)-wierd snow behavior. i know i know, its a beta. but sometimes snow will magically leave a trail in the air behind you when you jump, and it stays that way even on your next run down the mountain, this isnt a major issue but can cause issues lining up jumps and grinds in the parks.Overall: is SNOW worth it?if you have been craving some realistic extreme sports or if you are a mountain lifer then this game is definately for you. if you like exploring in a relaxing setting this game is probably for you. if you want somethinglike tony hawks pro skater on skis, you should stay far far away.

content:
er 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								At the moment, I can not recommend this game.Horrible Slushy controls:I have an Xbox One controller, yet the game kept insisting on showing me a PS4 controller layout.Movement commands felt laggy, and my machine way out specs the recommendations.Very poor tutorials:Telling a person how to do something is okay, but SHOWING them first works much better.Freedom is a good thing, but when you have no real direction in order to know how to usesaid freedom, freedom can become a burden.Stale and empty enviroment:At no time did I ever feel like I was on a real mountain.With stark, simple graphics, no AI wondering around ANYWHERE, no wild life, no wind or weather effects,Just felt like I was entirely alone on top of a mountain that man hadn't been to in 50 years.There were a few small things I did like.First-Person Camera and sense of speed:I did like the sense of speed once you could actually get some speed, and I liked the movementof the first-person camera.If I had to pick right now between this and Steep, Steep would win.You need to decide if your going for a simulation or a game.It feels more like a sim at the moment, but lacks the fidelity and precision of a simulation.The game feeling is not present at all. No fun, or excitement to be felt at all.Will review again once game leave Early Access.But for now, I wouldn't recommend spending any real money on this.This game has a long way to go before it is finished.

content:
ry 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								I understand that snow is now a Free To Play Beta, and that the game isn't expected to be perfect. I will just be saying how things are (for me and a lot of other people, not everyone). First off, SNOW is a lot of fun, singleplayer and (sometimes) multiplayer are great and the game has a lot of potential and it would be an amazing game if only... It worked, which it kinda doesn't at the moment. The game is constantly crashing (for me and a couple of others who tried out the game). Multiplayer is a mess.All the servers are mostly full because of the 12 players cap and they will always display that they have over 300+ ping when they actually don't. When hovering over someone's name in the spawnmenu the game will put a camera on them like you're spectating them. If you scroll through the players (unintetionally) the camera will glitch out and it might crash your game because the FPS drops to 0-2. Sometimes when you spawn, there will be random invisible walls right infront of you completely blocking your movement and it takes away all your points if you jump because of 'bad landing'. Sometimes the walls are placed a bit infront of you so after you gained some speed you instantly crash because of the god damn wall. Sometimes when other players spawn on you, it will make you crash instantly. These are the multiplayer problems I'm having, some might have the same, some might not.Singleplayer/EventsSingleplayer is a lot better than multiplayer in terms of the game working, but it gets easily boring skiing around by yourself. So you either jump into Multiplayer, or you go do some Events! (Since leveling up gives you no credits at all and you can unlock a yellow outfit through the events that are free. Now I warn you, if you haven't played the game or Events, this will frustrate the living **** out of you. Some Events are fairly easy, and some will make you rip your hair out. I'm not going to get into a lot of detail about this, but it kinda sucks that the events don't give you credits so you can buy your own gear instead of a boring yellow outfit. With all that said, the game is still worth downloading since it's free and it is fun, when it works.Like I said, I know this is a free to play beta and you can't expect too much from it just yet. I know the game will improve and I am definitely looking forwards to it.That's all I'm going to write for now..

content:
y 29, 2016
Early Access Review
First some further explaination and depth dwelling
At this point this game has been in development around 3 years, I think.One of the most important things in a game that prides itself as a more realistic winter sports game would be the physics, right?Well... it's not. I know there are people saying it's got perfect physics and all that, but I just can't see it. As a person living in the real world, having gone skiing quite a few times in my life, this game is just nowhere near where I would consider it to be realistic.But everything from the controls, the graphics and gameplay suggests that this is indeed a realistic game.It feels disjointed. Like one of the links is much weaker than the others.It's not just the bad physics (and, yes, I would say that it's not even my opinion but a fact), it's also the numerous glitches, lack of enviromental effects, no NPCs, crappy netcode (couldn't play multiplayer on a server with around 30ping), boring and repetitive soundtrack, lack of character customization and so on.Sure it's free, but we're expected to put in a lot of time and even money in this game. It's fair to expect more from this especially when reading the description and user reviews.It's a very ambitious project, even for bigger developers.Like I said it's not where it should be. This is not a good game by any stretch of the imagination (at this point). It's a great foundation and you can see the skill of the developers. So potential it does have. So my opinion is: Why even try? Why try making a realistic game when this is how it is now? I'm not saying to completely recreate the game into something cartoonish and ridiculous, but maybe loosen it up a notch.The game does not feel good at all to play, in my opinion. I think if they didn't try to recreate realistic physics, it may not end up feeling too bad. Like the good ol' SSX games. It still feels so good just to swoosh around in that.Depth dwelling over!I admit that I may be a bit biased and really what I want is more of an arcade experience like SSX, but please bare with me.First of all It doesn't feel very good to skii in this and it's quite boring because it feels too heavy and limiting to do any tricks.you might aswell just stick to real skiing trips with your buddies, because this is not gonna recreate that and I've played a game that recreates that better and its name is We Skii... Yes, I'm serious, and it really says something about SNOW.And it fails to be realistic too with its ridiculous physics (especially the ragdoll physics) and stiff animations. 


YouTube™ Video: SNOW!! 

			Views: 127		

			I can say without exaggeration that I have never laughed this hard from a snowboarding game in my life. Become a Bananner before it's cool!		

Honestly I just don't feel that realism has any place in a game like this. Why try and create a realistic game in a sport where you should have full control of your entire body? Compare NHL '99 with NHL 2011 for example. On one hand you have a very responsive and simple control style where you feel like you actually make your own mistakes. Sure it's not realistic, but it's enjoyable and you can easily call it a good hockey game. While the other feels needlessly sluggish in the name of "realism" and a lot of the fumbles feel like it's simulated in a really annoying manner. It tries to simulate realism but fails and just ends up making an inevitably unrealistic and boring game. And that's kind of what this feels like.Just embrace the limitations of a video game and go wild, I say. I don't think this game will ever succeed in creating a realistic and faithful experience, so I personally don't think that's worth pursuing.But other than all that I've said so far, it's not terribly made, they just need to fix all of the glitches and derpy physics, increase the server player limit, include some more things to do and maybe have some more controls like manual pole and ski control.Hopefully my ramblings gets my opinion across...Update: So I'm giving it more of a chance. Right now I'm trying the descent event and rail event.So descent really demonstrates a big issue with the controls. The air spin controls are mapped to the same stick as ground control, which means if you're not ready for some tiny air, which happens a lot on somewhat uneven slopes, get ready for your character to fly all over the place thanks to the extremely annoting tendency of over steering while landing from a lot of tiny unprepared jumps.It actualy makes me nervous of even steering at all.And as for the rail event: it made me realize the awfulness of the physics even more. It's just not fun to do any tricks. it's frustrating. I feel like they wanted to create something similar to SKATE, but failed miserably. See, SKATE gives you a lot of control of your board and character. This doesn't.About the physics: you can ski down stairs like it's nothing (I know that it's possible IRL, but not like this) and several times I was gliding along he sides of walls at like 2 kmph.Who the hell are the people saying the physics are good?! Seriously...

content:
2016
Early Access Review
								Really, really. Just seriously, so many glitches I encounter, making me not getting to a save point, losing all of my points... This game isn't really something that you spend tons and tons of time on, as you will get frustrated from the glitches. Sometimes when I jump off, my character freezes and cannot do a command except for basic ones like, turning and really nothing else. This could actually be fixed by wiping out, but most of the time as I try, it doesn't happen. Only get this game if you have tolerance for its glitches. I can see that you might be saying; "IT WAS MADE IN OCT 2013!" Well, its 3 years from then, and they should've already fixed them. It is also really hard to level up in the game too, which makes buying new gear and making it easier, requiring for 10s of hours. Only get it if you like to just play around, not going for a highscore or something, as I know a glitch will mess you up. Also, I can see that they have been doing some fixes, but FOR ME it says the last update a month ago FOR ME. And they have pretty close updates too. So really, they probably don't know how to fix what is happening to me (and us) meaning they have a bad team. No offense. I have also heard that in MAY 2016 it still is in BETA after 3 years. I don't see any potential in the game, as other devs work harder than them, releasing the out-of-BETA version out in 3 months to 2 years MAX. Only buy this game if you just do it in your freetime, not to break your friend's highscore, as the glitches will mess you up.

content:
er 29, 2013
Early Access Review
								I absolutely love this game and can't wait for all the new features, especially snowboarding as a boarder myself. Graphics are brilliant and the character animations are smooth and fluid, you can tell most of the devs are skiers themselves. At the moment only one side of on mountain is available to ski, but even this was enough to keep me entertained for hours, there's hundreds of different paths to choose and jumps placed at regular intervals.Some things I would like added are working ski lifts or helicopter drops, AI skiers on the slopes too, and the park to be extended a bit more. Maybe add a proper winter olympics style ski jump somewhere too.And to all the people complaining about a lack of features, the big blue bar saying EARLY ACCESS might have given you a clue as to what you are paying for - do your research before you click buy!!!

content:
9, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game should not be on Steam at all! It is broken and unplayable. Yes, you can say the game is in it's early alpha stages and I should expect bugs and general annoying gameplay. But when the developers announced that the game would be ready by Febuary of this year back in October of last and it isn't, well that just shows how little care they have for the game. I bought into the this game as the original discription that was on Steam at the first release of this half arsed early access, was snowboarding. At first they never pointed out that the snowboarding would be implimented later on in the game's life. All that was stated in the original discription is that the game was in early alpha and that it had some issues. I am sick and tired of developers throwing their game onto Steam as an "early access". It is terrible marketing and has already made me want to not play the game when it is fully released. If that ever happens! I shall remind you, this game was supposed to release as a free to play in Feb. It is no April and the game is yet to be released. If you are in need of money as a developer just to finish your game. Do not release it as an early access. Hype the game up, get better funding and make sure your target market knows about the game. I would have had no idea about this game as, from what I know, it has only been marketed on Steam. Get your ♥♥♥♥ together, developers! Stop releaseing paid, half arsed early access games with no guaranty that the game is even going to be release on time or even at all. I invested in this game because I thought at least one developer may get it right, but no. Just like the majority, they screw up and seem to have little to no care about the game itself and only the money. Now, after that rant, I can say some good things about this game. The graphics are beautiful. They really give the feeling of gliding through soft powder on a beautiful day. Or at least it does when it actually lets you spawn. The character customisation is actually good, with a wide range of branded products to chose from. Like K2 and Vokl. The mountain looks real and outstanding, especially in the highest settings. The game seems to run well with very little hiccups, even maxed out too. I honestly want to see this game succeed in a big way. But the way it is now and the way the developers failed to deliver a Febuary launch just take hope away. I am truly wanting a good snowboard/skiing sim to play as none that I have sunk any time or effort into have been rewarding. Games like Shaun White Snowboarding and Stoked are good but not outstanding. If the developers are able to pull all of this out of the bag, even with all the issues that it shouldn't have this far into the development of the game, I will recomend it. But right now, with all the issues and my personal hatred for early access game at this time, I can not recommend this game to anyone. I have hope for this game eventually turning out fantastic. But for now, it is slim. Every month I will pop back onto the game and give another test. And each time, I will edit this review. I hope for the better.

content:
17, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is my review of SNOW, an Early Access game about skis.The game is very hard to review without being picky, it's good and bad.The button help was for Xbox one and I used an Logitech Multi Mode controller, That was not really an issue.Pros:-The game was fun and was very in depth,-Even with regular physics fails the game ran perfectly smooth for such a big game,-Very calming,-Music was playing to fill in the lack of sound,-Drone mode, a great way to scout out the area before you ski.Cons:-Multiplayer was slow and clunky,-You have to unlock areas in the free roam meaning it wasnt really free roam,-The controller binds were dumb, Why would you bind X to go forward and not a trigger?-No music controls, I can't change to a different song on the fly,-Graphics settings are low by default, I had to do alot of tweaking to make it run,-No walk mode, I can't take in my surroundings while I am slipping around can I?Overall, I would recommend this game but not until loads of errors are ironed out of the game.

Early Access Review
								This is muy first review and what to keep it as fair and true as possible.The proson the upside the game is a very good idea and can see it going very far, dispite my short time playing it micro transactions didnt seem to be game changers, only visuals. Im sure in a few months to a years time the game will be absolutely brilliant, cram packed with content.The game is a very small file, approx 3-4GB meaning it will be downloaded fairly quickly. The consUpon startup the game crashed 3 times, then had an enourmous loading screen ( i dont know if this was a bug or if the game is just slow) upon entering the game you notice that it is clearly your steryotypical early access, very buggy, glitchy and a very clunky experience. Alongside that the visuals are very dated (dispite being run on cryengine).i believe this game has a lot of promise and is very likely to go far, however at the moment it just isnt shining, it still needs a lot of work (which i appreciate as it is early access).Overall i would rate the game a 5/10 it shows promise but at the date of writing this the game is nothing special

Early Access Review
								Pros:- Very good Graphics! Textures are brilliant and Cry Engine makes this game look fantastic- Immersion is great, Sounds are so lifelike and crisp and graphics come close to reality- Smooth experience on ultra- Multiplayer relatively smooth with a few hiccups- Great soundtrack!Cons:- Levelling system with few perks, this gives the player not much motivation to score big- Cash for ingame credits; this isn't too bad since the credits only pay for cosmetics but I think the game should have ways to unlock credits e.g level milestone 'every 25 or so levels'- Funny but stupid ragdoll death mechanics-Collision on some objects is odd and unrealistic (e.g hitting the side of a small rock and immediately crashing and falling.)Overall I would reccomend this game to my friends because there is simply no other game like this on the market. content:
13, 2015
Early Access Review
10/10 !!This is definitely the best skiing game I've ever played, and it still is. The recently implemented new mechanics are not as good as they could be, but the developers already told us fixes are coming with the 0.5.1 patch.Well... After the closed beta update, 0.5.0, people are whining a lot about the new changes. Especially because they can't get their cosmetic items (for free!), which does absolutely nothing, besides making you look a little unique. You can still ride all the mountains, try out all the events, and you're certainly not limited by any micro-transactions gameplay-wise. You can use all the grabs, ride just as fast, and compete in just as many events as you want to - FOR FREE!This is what I would like to see in EVERY Free-to-Play game. Where you ONLY have to (optionally) pay for cosmetic items. Here in SNOW, as it is in 0.5.0, you can't pay to get BETTER. You can only look slightly 'cooler'.On a whole 'nother note, here's a few quotes by a few developers from Poppermost, the company who makes the game SNOW, regarding the new shop and the new mechanics:1. Asurao: "We have no plans to charge you for new levels/mountains. We want everyone to be able to ride together whether they've spent money or not. This is core to the game." and "There will be many ways to earn credits in the future".(>>Source<<)2. Rubadubdub!: "I can ensure you that there will be other ways of getting new gear in the future, so you'll still be able to get pretty good gear just like in TF2, CS: GO etc."(>>Source<<)3. Asurao: "As we continue working towards Open Beta (0.6.0) we will be adding player progression (a leveling system) so that you can earn items without having to buy them">>Source<<4. Asurao: "I agree that the break-turn isn't working as intended and overall speed management feels very sporadic. We're looking into this and will make improvements in future updates."(>>Source<<)

content:
ry 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								I haven't played this game long enough to give a full opinion yet, but from my first impressions, this game looks like it has quite a lot of potential. I had a lot of fun figuring out how to do tricks on the infinity pipe, which was a lot of fun, and it made me think how much better this game will be with a fully completed map and snowboards, and more options to customize your character. This game has a lot of potential, being the ONLY f2p, free roam winter sports simulator on the market. Download this game right now if you didn't have the opportunity!

content:
, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								I don't normally review games, but SNOW has so much potential that i feel i have to give my feedback on it.First of all, it's a great idea, there's no other games like this and the free-roaming skiing premise has not been done very much before. Bearing in mind that it's completely free-to-play, i think it very good. It's still got many bugs, but as a free to play early access that only to be expected. There's a huge variety of maps, and the controls are relatively easy to get the hang of.However, the new update has caused my character to die whenever i get dropped off, meaning only snowboarding works as an option, which is very frustrating as skiing feels more fluid at the moment. Also, the charcter model has completely disappeared (if intentional this really detracts from the game), so my skier has is merely a floating hat and gloves, with no body.Would I recommend? Yes. its free, so why not? There are many bugs and it's certainly still in early stages, but there is huge potential here, and a finished product could be outstanding.

content:
y 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								I love skiing. This game is tagged as "Simulation" but to be honest, it isn't that realistic. The physics is pretty weird and glitchy, in a lot of situations the character should die miserably... but he doesn't even fall.Maybe "arcade" or "casual" would be more appropriate.SNOW is still in beta, so maybe will change... but I don't think so.This doesn't mean that the game is bad. It's a F2P and there are tons of terrible paid games on steam.If you want give it a try, don't be afraid of the "mixed", the game is not a masterpiece but it isn't trash too.Looks like someone paid for this game, that's why there are a lot of negative reviews: devs decided to go from paid game to F2P with micro-transactions, I would be ♥♥♥♥♥♥ too, bad move.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
13, 2015
Early Access Review
10/10 !!This is definitely the best skiing game I've ever played, and it still is. The recently implemented new mechanics are not as good as they could be, but the developers already told us fixes are coming with the 0.5.1 patch.Well... After the closed beta update, 0.5.0, people are whining a lot about the new changes. Especially because they can't get their cosmetic items (for free!), which does absolutely nothing, besides making you look a little unique. You can still ride all the mountains, try out all the events, and you're certainly not limited by any micro-transactions gameplay-wise. You can use all the grabs, ride just as fast, and compete in just as many events as you want to - FOR FREE!This is what I would like to see in EVERY Free-to-Play game. Where you ONLY have to (optionally) pay for cosmetic items. Here in SNOW, as it is in 0.5.0, you can't pay to get BETTER. You can only look slightly 'cooler'.On a whole 'nother note, here's a few quotes by a few developers from Poppermost, the company who makes the game SNOW, regarding the new shop and the new mechanics:1. Asurao: "We have no plans to charge you for new levels/mountains. We want everyone to be able to ride together whether they've spent money or not. This is core to the game." and "There will be many ways to earn credits in the future".(>>Source<<)2. Rubadubdub!: "I can ensure you that there will be other ways of getting new gear in the future, so you'll still be able to get pretty good gear just like in TF2, CS: GO etc."(>>Source<<)3. Asurao: "As we continue working towards Open Beta (0.6.0) we will be adding player progression (a leveling system) so that you can earn items without having to buy them">>Source<<4. Asurao: "I agree that the break-turn isn't working as intended and overall speed management feels very sporadic. We're looking into this and will make improvements in future updates."(>>Source<<)

content:
y 15, 2016
Early Access Review
A game with ALOT of potential.Stuff that it desperately needs:-dynamic snow-dynamic weather-skiis (don't know how to pronounce it) NEED to be going through the snow in deep snow. They can't just float on white textures.-An after-ski area where people can enjoy unique minigames-make interactions with players in multiplayer (races, challenges)-LIFTS. In multiplayer the devs  should make an option (when you enter the ski lift) to either 1. Wait for other players to fill the lift seats. When in the lift the players should be able to talk with each otherOR 2. just ride alone-HUGE ONE. Gameplay. Improve how the game feels. It is really important because I wanted to explore the different areas but the skiing looks stiff and the gameplay is rather boring.-This game lacks in animations. The animations are also super important because if you pull of a sick trick it has to look really badass. Not some locked animation and the model just rotates. Look at the game SSX and learn from that (they really nailed the gameplay and badassnes in that one).So. For now just give it try and see for yourself if you are into it or not. I am really hoping this to be a big one.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
er 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pros:- Very good Graphics! Textures are brilliant and Cry Engine makes this game look fantastic- Immersion is great, Sounds are so lifelike and crisp and graphics come close to reality- Smooth experience on ultra- Multiplayer relatively smooth with a few hiccups- Great soundtrack!Cons:- Levelling system with few perks, this gives the player not much motivation to score big- Cash for ingame credits; this isn't too bad since the credits only pay for cosmetics but I think the game should have ways to unlock credits e.g level milestone 'every 25 or so levels'- Funny but stupid ragdoll death mechanics-Collision on some objects is odd and unrealistic (e.g hitting the side of a small rock and immediately crashing and falling.)Overall I would reccomend this game to my friends because there is simply no other game like this on the market. Open world skiing is extremely enjoyable due to exploration, tricks and other awesome features such as unlockable areas.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is muy first review and what to keep it as fair and true as possible.The proson the upside the game is a very good idea and can see it going very far, dispite my short time playing it micro transactions didnt seem to be game changers, only visuals. Im sure in a few months to a years time the game will be absolutely brilliant, cram packed with content.The game is a very small file, approx 3-4GB meaning it will be downloaded fairly quickly. The consUpon startup the game crashed 3 times, then had an enourmous loading screen ( i dont know if this was a bug or if the game is just slow) upon entering the game you notice that it is clearly your steryotypical early access, very buggy, glitchy and a very clunky experience. Alongside that the visuals are very dated (dispite being run on cryengine).i believe this game has a lot of promise and is very likely to go far, however at the moment it just isnt shining, it still needs a lot of work (which i appreciate as it is early access).Overall i would rate the game a 5/10 it shows promise but at the date of writing this the game is nothing special

content:
2015
Early Access Review
								If we assume that its early access then we can talk about future improvements. The game is full of backs starting from the menu and finishing inside the mountains. A lot of crashes for no actual reason. And another small problem is all these microtransactions. You cant buy even a new shirt without real money. BUTThis game has a great potential and can become a really successful game if the devs make it right. Graphics looks great , gameplay with some improvements can become even greater, maps are wonderful , music is cool (considering some1 is using it) and this minimalistic menu style is really cool.What needs to be done? I believe that devs must go from a free to play game with microtransactions to a priced game with no microtransactions. If they keep the game like that they have a 90% chance to fail hard. But if they fix the bugs(that they will fix , dont forget its early access) and make it a game you actually buy and then you are good to go then they will have a great success in my opinion. After all its a great idea so I will rate with 7.5/10. Ohhh and devs... Please add snowboards in the game.<3

y 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is really enjoyable and ran smoothly on my pc. High quality textures and a very large draw distance. I highly recommend this game to anyone that enjoys skiing. This game has a big learning curve but it's really fun and has a very high replay value. (It's really hard to land tricks perfectly) The tutorial is garbage, I didn't learn anything in it and I never passed the third part where you have to land a 720 spinning jump, I don't know the button combinations. The best way is to free-play on the mountain. There are some bugs but they aren't game breaking. Sometimes I hit something and I crash and on the next run I hit the same object but it just affects my score instead of having me go back.This game has a lot of potential and is already expanse. I wish that the lifts were operational and you could ride them. I also wish that there was a map because I've gotten lost quite a few times. TL;DR = Don't buy unless you are a skiing enthusiast, just wait until it’s f2p

content:
3, 2016
Early Access Review
Snow is a great F2P skiing/ snowboarding simulator, reminiscent of the Skate franchise. It features both singleplayer and multiplayer game modes, with a healthy community to play around with.  Graphically the game is gorgeous! It uses the CryEngine, which allows advanced options for configuration. The neverending mountains really are a treat for the eye here, folks.  You'll also be skiing down the slopes, listening to the euphoric ambient music, accompanying you through the hills. Snow also offers you some nice, relaxing custom tracks to soothe you. It's a surprise how well the controls handle! Even when using a keyboard, the controls are easy to get the hang of and master. Rarely do they cause problems. It's nice to know that the game supports gamepads, too. Snow offers natural character progression. It's quite simple - the more you play, the better you get. There is a variety of character customization options, you can be decked out from head to toes. These cosmetic items do require in-game purchases, but you can obtain credits for them through playing. As a third option, there is always the communtiy market. Only remarks. While everything else is great, the physics need some refining. There are some awkward moments with the character movement and object collision. Grinding, in particular, is terrible. While the developers have given us a product of high quality, Snow falls a little short of being the next big thing, for the moment at least.

content:
ber 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Let me start by saying THANK YOU for not creating an SSX.  But...So far, this game still isn't at par with most simulator type skiing\snowboarding games that have already been on the market.  The character is stiff, weightless, and too obviously procedurally driven.  It looks and feels like you are controlling the skiis not the rider.  The controls are very binary when they should take advantage of modern analog controllers. For instance, regardless if you tap the steering controls or hold, the character drops right into the extremity of the turning poses.  Same for grabs and any other feedback coming from the character. There is no sense of speed unless you are in the trees. The levels feel wide open, flat, and tricking opportunities are sparse. The jumps in the parks feel dauntingly huge and are seemingly too big for the lack of speed even at max speed.   The physics feel just as binary as the controls and don't work well with the level design metrics for the terrain or park obstacles.  Rails riding is quirky and the rider looks dorky. Halfpipe riding is frustrating and it's nearly impossible to get any speed\air.  The radgoll is just broken, and bailing in any game other than EA Skate isn't fun. It's punishing and wastes a players time.  The best parts of this game are the jump on the right thumbstick (thank you EA Skate) when it works and doesn't give you an awkward emote instead. As well, a huge plus is having the generous ability to customize the ingame camera.  This game has a long way to go before Beta.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
y 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'll admit, I was skeptical. I've been waiting for a game like this, as an avid snowboarder/skier. I had been starting to lose hope.And then... SNOW came along.Oh, SNOW. Where have you been all my life?PROS:- Incredible graphics, lighting is very good as well.- Already tons of content in the store, from jackets to skis to tophats.- Decent physics engine- World is massive, and I mean MASSIVE. It's at least an 8 minute trip to the bottom if you have fun with it.- The park is on point with what I'd like to see in this type of game. Two sections, one street and one with big booters.- Just generally fun.CONS/Things that are missing/Things I'd like to see implemented:- No audio (yet)- Pressing escape while on the mountain takes you to the main menu and 'Do you want to quit?' dialog. Kind of annoying if I just want to restart my run.- I can't actually see my skier in the customization menu when I'm in it, so if I select something I have to actually hit the mountain to see what it looks like.- Collision models are a little off. The front half of the skis don't even seem to have a collision body, and just go right through rails.- Jumping feels sluggish, and I sometimes struggle to get enough air not to knuckle on the jumps.- The pushing animation is very jerky and abrupt. I'd like to see it so that holding W produces a nice, fluent, repeating pushing motion so you don't have to continually press W to gain speed.- I think the turn speed could be increased a little. Seems a little wide for my experience.- A help menu would be very beneficially, as I haven't fully figured out all the controls yet.I'm still in love with this game. I understand it's in early alpha and would be more than happy to contribute to the development process in any way possible. I hope the devs read this review, because they have my eternal thanks and respect.

								Honestly thought the game was not what it was worked up to be upon getting it on the steam sale. It is early access but I gave into the extra tester pack, I thought I should just give in there, no point in playing anymore. I had troubles with controls, and got stuck several times, but I prevailed and gave it a few more hours. The views are wonderful, theres tons of small easter eggs and a book a tricks that keeps getting bigger. Is this game complete? No, but the developer(s) are part of this community and are actively trying to fix bugs with the help of us. This game already looks beautiful and is a must have for skiers and boarders alike. Definately get SNOW if you want to see a completed version of this game and support the devs.

content:
ry 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I want to start by saying my first impressions were great but as i explored and played more it got worse and worse.The game has an expansive options menu and a large open world to explore. The game ran great with maxed settings  on my overclocked r9 390 without any stuttering. I was met with my first bug in the tutorial when it asked me to preform a trick and no matter what i did it wouldnt register at all so i quit the tutorial with the basics in mind and set out the open mountains.... except i apperantly scrolled through the drop selection menu too fast and crashed my game so that my screen was covered in black nothingness so i had to reboot my pc. Once i rebooted and scrolled through the drops at a snails pace i got to skiing. It was great doing tricks, flying through the air like a spinning top, crashing and watching the halarious glitched out wipe outs untill after every rock and rewind my character would do weird things like get stuck in t-pose or go down the mountains unable to jump brake or move at some points. My final thoughts are if your just there for the scenery or want to spend real money on ingame skins or clothing and dont mind the sometimes gamebreaking glitches then this is the game for you. But if you want to ski arround without having to troubleshoot some weird bug every few minutes than i would reccomend you get Wii Ski Resort and play that because that is better than this hunk of yellow SNOW.

content:
ry 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								SNOW is a free to play skiing simulator that is absolutely BADASS.From the 7 hours I have played of this game, I am throughly enjoyed. PC has never gotten a skiing/snowboarding game ever and this game is the perfect way to start. Graphics:Absolutely beautiful. Best graphics I have seen in a very long time and it is also coded amazingly. I can run the game on Ultra at 60 fps and my computer really isn't that good.Movements:As of right now, you can tell the movements they have now are place holders. The body is very stiff and moves more like a robot. You can tell by the movements that the game is still in early beta. Obviously the ragdoll is terrible, but none the less is really funny waatching your guy flop down the hill with a few broken bones and a twisted neck.Music/Sounds:Adrian Blood.. What can I say? The music is amazing. It's the perfect feel of chill and EDM. If I was to go skiing one day, this will be the music I listen to. The sounds are high quality and match with the game very well.Maps:Perfectly designed. The most of the maps on the game are based off of real places.What I Would Like To See:Snowboards! We know they are coming and it will be awesome when they come. Map Creator! It would be awesome making your own tracks and having races on the tracks you make with your friends.Custom Graphics! Would be so cool to make your own clothing and make your own designs on the skis.Do I recommend this game? HELL YEAH!It's free to play! If you want to buy clothing and other in game stuff, better fork out some big bucks because the cheapest thing is $5 for 500 in game coins that can buy you a jacket, pants, gloves, and a mask. None the less, all the tracks are free and its free to play multiplayer.Cons:Super expensive and hard to earn coins.(I got for leveling up to level 5 10 coins. 10 coins can't buy me anything in the game. The cheapest thing in the game is 89 coins and its a damn party hat.)Summary: Super fun! Great graphics! Great music! HUNDREDS of items to choose from! Can't buy ♥♥♥♥! I RECOMMEND!

content:
y 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								For what it is this game is awesome. I think with continued development of more mountains and more events it will be super solid. Its got good mechanics, easy to pick up but hard to master. Like all early access games it has its moments. Grinding right now is by far the most underwhelming thing in the game but the last few updates have been making it a lot better. Its no Tony Hawk "Press X to do tricks" its more like the Skate games where you actually had to do some prep work for your tricks, like aligning your trajectories and landing properly or death. Also, to go along with the Skate games the massive and brutal crashes make this game a total riot. Ragdolling down the mountain in this game is as funny as Goat Simulator but without the "why am I even playing this?" vibe. Hoping when all is said and done that snowboarding and snowmobiles are well executed and I would love to see a mountain editor. Keep up the good work devs!
